Class AdminUserModifyPage

java.lang.Object
application.framework.BasePage
application.pages.admin.AdminUserModifyPage
public class AdminUserModifyPage extends BasePage
A page that displays details on a user, allowing creation, updating, and deletion of user roles. The page also allows for deletion of users, and for modification of an admins own roles. Non-admin users are redirected to this page to create or reopen an AdminRequest, but they are not allowed to make instantaneous changes like an admin could. Instead, they select the changes they want, then an AdminRequest is created according to the changes they selected.
Author:
Mike, Tyler

    • setTargetUser

      public static void setTargetUser(User user)
      Sets the target user to be modified. This must be called by the calling page before navigating to this page.
      Parameters:
      user - The user to modify.

    • setExistingRequest

      public static void setExistingRequest(AdminRequest request)
      Sets the existingRequest. May be called before navigating to the page if a request is being reopened.
      Parameters:
      request - The request to be reopened.

      Specified by:

      Returns:
      The root pane for the page's layout.

    • isLastAdmin

      private boolean isLastAdmin(User user)
      Helper method to check if the user is the last admin.

    • handleUserDeletion

      private void handleUserDeletion(User targetUser)
      Helper method to handle deletion of the targetUser. If the current user is not an admin, an AdminRequest will be created instead.
      Parameters:
      targetUser - the user to be deleted from the database.

    • requestRolesChange

      private void requestRolesChange(User targetUser, int roleInt)
      Helper method to create an AdminRequest to change the roles of the targetUser to the currently selected roles in the role checkboxes.
      Parameters:
      targetUser - The user whose roles are to be changed.
      roleInt - The roles the targetUser is to be given.

    • sendAdminRequest

      private void sendAdminRequest(AdminActions action, Integer contextInt)
      If a request is being reopened, that request is updated with the given action and roleInt. Otherwise, a new request is created.
      Parameters:
      action - The action of the request.
      contextInt - The roleInt or 0/1 for the request.
